item.title: Cyber Attacks Spread Across Europe Using Stolen NSA Tool
item.description: June 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel speaks with Dmitri Alperovitch, co-founder and chief technology officer of CrowdStrike, about the cyber attacks spreading across Europe using a stolen National Security Agency tool.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel speaks with Dmitri Alperovitch, co-founder and chief technology officer of CrowdStrike, about the cyber attacks spreading across Europe using a stolen National Security Agency tool. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534597160/cyber-attacks-spread-across-europe-using-stolen-nsa-tool

item.title: Massive Ransomware Attack Hits Ukraine; Experts Say It's Spreading Globally
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Some have called the previously seen malware "Petya," though others say it is "a new ransomware that has not been seen before." It has been reported in at least a half-dozen countries.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Some have called the previously seen malware "Petya," though others say it is "a new ransomware that has not been seen before." It has been reported in at least a half-dozen countries. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/27/534560169/large-cyberattack-hits-ukraine-snarling-electric-grids-and-airports

item.title: Driving The Future: How Smart Can A Smart Car Be?
item.description: June 27, 2017 - Car owners form special relationships with their vehicles — they give them names, customize them and get to know their intricacies and quirks. But what if the car could do the same for the driver?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Car owners form special relationships with their vehicles — they give them names, customize them and get to know their intricacies and quirks. But what if the car could do the same for the driver? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-27/technology-and-the-auto-industry

item.title: Beyond The Valley Of The CEOs — Bringing Big Tech To Small Towns
item.description:
June 27, 2017 - Venture capital is concentrated on the coasts — how can investors be encouraged to spread the wealth?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-27/technology-and-the-economy
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - Venture capital is concentrated on the coasts — how can investors be encouraged to spread the wealth? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-27/technology-and-the-economy

item.title: Google Fined Record $2.7 Billion In EU Anti-Trust Ruling
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The European Union says Google unfairly abused its power over search results to promote its own over competitors. It's the biggest fine the EU has ever given a single company in an anti-trust case.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The European Union says Google unfairly abused its power over search results to promote its own over competitors. It's the biggest fine the EU has ever given a single company in an anti-trust case. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/27/534537556/google-fined-record-2-7-billion-in-eu-anti-trust-ruling

item.title: Google Hit With $2.7 Billion Fine By European Antitrust Monitor
item.description: June 27, 2017 - The European Commission says Google "abused its market dominance as a search engine by promoting its own comparison shopping service in its search results, and demoting those of competitors."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 27, 2017 - The European Commission says Google "abused its market dominance as a search engine by promoting its own comparison shopping service in its search results, and demoting those of competitors." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/27/534524024/google-hit-with-2-7-billion-fine-by-european-antitrust-monitor

item.title: Google Says It Will No Longer Read Users' Emails To Sell Targeted Ads
item.description: June 26, 2017 - The company says it will make the change later this year, bringing Gmail in line with its business products. But Google has already gathered a lot of data on users since it launched Gmail in 2004.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - The company says it will make the change later this year, bringing Gmail in line with its business products. But Google has already gathered a lot of data on users since it launched Gmail in 2004. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/26/534451513/google-says-it-will-no-longer-read-users-emails-to-sell-targeted-ads

item.title: Facial Recognition May Boost Airport Security But Raises Privacy Worries
item.description: June 26, 2017 - If you travel from Boston's Logan Airport to Aruba on JetBlue you can use your face as identification rather than a passport. Similar experiments in facial recognition are underway at other airports.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - If you travel from Boston's Logan Airport to Aruba on JetBlue you can use your face as identification rather than a passport. Similar experiments in facial recognition are underway at other airports. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/26/534131967/facial-recognition-may-boost-airport-security-but-raises-privacy-worries

item.title: How Will Things Change For Shoppers After Amazon Buys Whole Foods?
item.description: June 26, 2017 - It was recently announced that Amazon was going to acquire Whole Foods, giving the web giant a physical presence in nearly 450 locations across the country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - It was recently announced that Amazon was going to acquire Whole Foods, giving the web giant a physical presence in nearly 450 locations across the country. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534378678/how-will-things-change-for-shoppers-after-amazon-buys-whole-foods

item.title: How To Pick Kids' Apps For The Backseat This Summer
item.description:
June 26, 2017 - Screen time can be more than a distraction if you follow these principles.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/06/26/533788062/how-to-pick-kids-apps-for-the-backseat-this-summer
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Screen time can be more than a distraction if you follow these principles. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/06/26/533788062/how-to-pick-kids-apps-for-the-backseat-this-summer

item.title: Schools Let Students Take Laptops Home In Hopes Of Curbing 'Summer Slide'
item.description: June 24, 2017 - More districts are letting students take computers home for the summer. Officials hope the devices help fill in learning gaps, but experts say parents must play a role to make the lending effective.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - More districts are letting students take computers home for the summer. Officials hope the devices help fill in learning gaps, but experts say parents must play a role to make the lending effective. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/24/534151564/schools-let-students-take-laptops-home-in-hopes-of-curbing-summer-slide

item.title: Drone Company Leaders Meet With Trump To Ask For More Clarity On Rules
item.description: June 24, 2017 - This week, U.S. drone companies met with President Trump to discuss industry regulations. NPR's Melissa Block talks with April Glaser of Recode about how these companies actually want more regulation.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - This week, U.S. drone companies met with President Trump to discuss industry regulations. NPR's Melissa Block talks with April Glaser of Recode about how these companies actually want more regulation. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/24/534207526/drone-company-leaders-meet-with-trump-to-ask-for-more-clarity-on-rules

item.title: Arkansas Tries To Stop An Epidemic Of Herbicide Damage
item.description: June 23, 2017 - A weedkiller called dicamba, which farmers hoped could banish herbicide-resistant weeds, has become a plague itself in Arkansas. The state's regulators just voted to ban it for 120 days.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - A weedkiller called dicamba, which farmers hoped could banish herbicide-resistant weeds, has become a plague itself in Arkansas. The state's regulators just voted to ban it for 120 days. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/23/534117683/arkansas-tries-to-stop-an-epidemic-of-herbicide-damage

item.title: What Uber's Leadership Change Means For Diversity In Tech
item.description: June 23, 2017 - NPR's Rachel Martin speaks to tech industry recruiter and consultant Y-Vonne Hutchinson about the resignation of former Uber CEO Travis Kalanick, and the message it sends to Silicon Valley.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - NPR's Rachel Martin speaks to tech industry recruiter and consultant Y-Vonne Hutchinson about the resignation of former Uber CEO Travis Kalanick, and the message it sends to Silicon Valley. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/23/534056720/what-ubers-leadership-change-means-for-diversity-in-tech

item.title: Facebook Changes Its Mission With Announcement About Groups
item.description: June 22, 2017 - Facebook has nearly 2 billion users. But that's not enough. Now, in an effort to go deep, not just wide, the company will focus on users' activity levels.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - Facebook has nearly 2 billion users. But that's not enough. Now, in an effort to go deep, not just wide, the company will focus on users' activity levels. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/06/22/534018001/facebook-changes-its-mission-with-groups-announcement
